snippet: A daily pill of the drug isoniazid can often fend off fatal tuberculosis in people with H.I.V., according to a large new study.
abstract: Study in journal Lancet Infectious Disease shows that daily dose of isoniazid, a generic antibiotic, can often fend off lethal bouts of tuberculosis in people with HIV.
lead_paragraph: A daily pill of the drug isoniazid can often fend off fatal tuberculosis in people with H.I.V., according to a large new study.

headline.main: Pill Can Prevent Fatal TB in H.I.V. Patients
